page.title: 08The New Cut
page.content:
In 1952, the drainage measures failed, and St.Germans was flooded. Locals still vividly remember the disaster.
To try and prevent a recurrence, a canal was dug - wide and deep - which diverts much of the water drained from the fields away from the Great Ouse. (It was this river which had been unable to cope in 1952.)
The NEW CUT runs parallel to the river, and a few km to the east of it. It re-joins the Ouse near to the sea, at a large pumping station which lifts the New Cut water into the Ouse.
The New Cut does not pass closely to existing villages and has become a popular recreational area, for boating and bank-walking.
